title: Turbulence 2 (Revised version commissioned by ACMI)
material_description: interactive touch-screen and computer, colour, software, video and monitor
brief_description: Turbulence is an interactive museum of un-natural history where a menagerie of synthesised forms, ‘evolved’ within the computer using a process of artificial selection. It is one of the most awarded and recognised works of Australian multimedia art. The work consists of a touch-screen interface, used to access a virtual museum of evolved electronic creatures. Over 3 years in production, Turbulence is a collection of abstract thoughts, simulations, ideas, information and poetry. A multiplex of links into an interactive web of computer synthesised imagery relating to the philosophical impact of evolution on contemporary thought.
